CookieHandlerElement Class

In this Article

Represents the <cookieHandler> configuration element.

Syntax

Declaration

public class CookieHandlerElement : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
  • CookieHandlerElement

Remarks

The <cookieHandler> element is a child element of the <federatedAuthentication> element; the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthenticationElement.CookieHandler%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to an instance of the CookieHandlerElement class. The <cookieHandler> element is used to configure the cookie handler used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM), which is represented by the SessionAuthenticationModule class.

A cookie handler can be configured in one of the following ways:

  • To configure a chunked cookie handler, set the Mode property to either CookieHandlerMode or CookieHandlerMode and set the ChunkedCookieHandler property with the configuration element for your chunked cookie handler. The CustomCookieHandler property should not be set.

  • To configure a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size, you can set the Mode property as mentioned earlier, but leave both the ChunkedCookieHandler and the CustomCookieHandler properties unset.

  • To configure a custom cookie handler, set the Mode property to CookieHandlerMode and set the CustomCookieHandler property with the configuration element that identifies the type of your custom cookie handler. This type must derive from the CookieHandler class. The ChunkedCookieHandler property should not be set.

Constructors summary

CookieHandlerElement()

Initializes a new instance of the CookieHandlerElement class.

Properties summary

ChunkedCookieHandler

Gets or sets a chunked cookie handler.
CustomCookieHandler

Gets or sets a custom cookie handler type. This property must be set when a custom cookie handler is being configured.
Domain

Gets or sets the domain value for cookies written by the handler.
HideFromScript

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the httpOnly property of the cookies written by this handler should be set.
Mode

Gets or sets the cookie handler mode.
Name

Gets or sets the base name for any cookies written by the handler.
Path

Gets or sets the path value for cookies written by the handler.
PersistentSessionLifetime

Gets or sets the lifetime of cookies issued by the handler.
RequireSsl

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the cookie should be used only with SSL.

Methods summary

GetConfiguredCookieHandler()

Gets a new cookie handler based on the configuration properties.

Constructors

  • CookieHandlerElement()

    Initializes a new instance of the CookieHandlerElement class.

    public CookieHandlerElement ();

Properties

  • ChunkedCookieHandler

    Gets or sets a chunked cookie handler.

    public System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandlerElement ChunkedCookieHandler { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ChunkedCookieHandlerElement

      A ChunkedCookieHandlerElement that provides additional configuration for the chunked cookie handler.

    Remarks

    This property is equivalent to the <chunkedCookieHandler> child element of the <cookieHandler> element. It specifies a chunked cookie handler, an instance of the ChunkedCookieHandler class, to use. If it is set, the Mode property should be set to either CookieHandlerMode or CookieHandlerMode. If the Mode property is set to either of these values but the ChunkedCookieHandler property is not set, a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size (System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler.DefaultChunkSize) is configured.

    Either the ChunkedCookieHandler property or the CustomCookieHandler property may be set, but not both.

  • CustomCookieHandler

    Gets or sets a custom cookie handler type. This property must be set when a custom cookie handler is being configured.

    public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement CustomCookieHandler { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • CustomTypeElement

      A CustomTypeElement that defines the custom cookie handler type.

    Remarks

    This property is equivalent to the <customCookieHandler> child element of the <cookieHandler> element. It specifies a custom cookie handler type to use. If this property is set, the Mode property must be set to CookieHandlerMode. The custom type specified by this property must be derived from the CookieHandler class.

    Either the ChunkedCookieHandler property or the CustomCookieHandler property may be set, but not both.

  • Domain

    Gets or sets the domain value for cookies written by the handler.

    public string Domain { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The domain value. The default is an empty string.

    Remarks

    Represents the domain attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • HideFromScript

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the httpOnly property of the cookies written by this handler should be set.

    public bool HideFromScript { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the httpOnly property should be set; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Controls whether the "HttpOnly" flag is emitted for any cookies written. Certain Web browsers honor this flag by keeping client-side script from accessing the cookie value.

    Represents the hideFromScript attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • Mode

    Gets or sets the cookie handler mode.

    public System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode Mode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • CookieHandlerMode

      A valid CookieHandlerMode value that indicates the kind of cookie handler that is being configured. The default value is CookieHandlerMode, which indicates a chunked cookie handler.

    Remarks

    For chunked cookie handlers (the ChunkedCookieHandler property is set), the mode should be set to either CookieHandlerMode or CookieHandlerMode. For a custom cookie handler (the CustomCookieHandler property is set), the mode should be set to CookieHandlerMode.

    Represents the mode attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • Name

    Gets or sets the base name for any cookies written by the handler.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The base name for the cookies. The default is “FedAuth”.

    Remarks

    Represents the name attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • Path

    Gets or sets the path value for cookies written by the handler.

    public string Path { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the path.

    Remarks

    If no path is defined, the path defined by the AppDomainAppVirtualPath property is used.

    Represents the path attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • PersistentSessionLifetime

    Gets or sets the lifetime of cookies issued by the handler.

    public TimeSpan PersistentSessionLifetime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the cookie lifetime. The default is 0 days (“0.0:0:0”). The value must be a value between 0 (“0.0:0:0”) and 365 (“365.0:0:0”) days.

    Remarks

    Represents the persistentSessionLifetime attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

  • RequireSsl

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the cookie should be used only with SSL.

    public bool RequireSsl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the cookie should only be used over an SSL connection; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Controls whether the "Secure" flag is emitted for any cookies written. If this value is true, the sign-in session cookies will only be available over HTTPS.

    Represents the requireSSL attribute of the <cookieHandler> element.

Methods

  • GetConfiguredCookieHandler()

    Gets a new cookie handler based on the configuration properties.

    public System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler GetConfiguredCookieHandler ();

    Returns

    • CookieHandler

      The cookie handler. This will be an instance of CookieHandler or ChunkedCookieHandler depending on the kind of handler that is configured by the properties of the current instance.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      A cookie handler cannot be created from the properties of the current instance.

    Remarks

    This method returns a cookie handler that is consistent with the configuration. The cookie handler returned will be either a chunked cookie handler or a custom cookie handler depending on how the configuration properties are set. For more information, see CookieHandlerElement.
